storyInfo: Months later, after a failed assassination attempt, a messenger returns from Kazdel with a mission from an organization known as 'Babel.' In the midst of turmoil, the mercenaries accept their fate.

attributes.content: Several months later...
4:28 P.M. \ Cloudy
Military buffer zone between Kazdel's east/west battlegrounds
A small ambush.
Looks like you were right. A lot of people do seem to be after my head. What a pain.
Not too many of them. They must be trying to cut off the head of the snake in a hit-and-run.
We only have half a squad left. What a perfect time to try and take me out.
...Too bad for them it's a little too perfect. Just as planned.
All right, I'll catch up with you later. The Messenger for Kazdel should be back in a minute.
...What are you looking for?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: That corpse... that's the assassin?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: ...Yeah.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I knew he'd have it on him.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: A note...?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Actually, wait, did you know this guy?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We've worked together before. Went through hell together. Just a few months ago, we were at the Scar Market, toasting to a job well done.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: He even said he wanted his daughter to marry me.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: That's dumb. You're mercenaries. Sooner or later...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Hold on, you didn't really—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Of course not. I turned him down.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...For other reasons, of course.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: So, what does it say?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Useful stuff. Some intel from the Market. Gossip. Things worth looking into.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...And what about this?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: They're all names... No, all pseudonyms or code names. And there's... candy drawn on the back of this? What's all this supposed to mean?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: The more pieces of candy, the higher the payout. It's a system only a piece of shit like him could come up with. Whoever gets the most candies is the most dangerous mercenary.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Creeps like that really leave a bad taste in your mouth.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: ...But then again, this adds up to a fat stack. Who's footing the bill?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Every time we complete a contract, someone will usually put up an additional sum to get rid of us. Like whoever hired us, for example.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The more powerful the mercenary, the bigger the bounty. The bigger the bounty, the greater the risk. The greater the risk, the more they need to kill off the merc. And the mercs who live through all this... they become the strongest.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: This war has driven us to the brink of death, but it's also left room for us to survive.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I guess that all works.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: It's the rules of the game.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ... 'Hoederer, Mercenary, 10 candies. Tough squad, 15 candies. We're acquainted, 20 candies.'
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Can't fault his accounting.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: 'W, the old one, taken care of. The new one is a problem. 10 candies, maybe more, situational.'
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Sounds like you earned your candies too.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Might have something to do with those arms dealers I buried alive in the woods last month.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Hah... So, am I supposed to be happy about this?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Arms dealers, huh... Why am I learning about this just now?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I was just in the neighborhood.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: When you guys raid the Laterano caravans, do you bother reporting each and every one?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Right? It's the same idea.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Since this isn't technically a part of the job, it's not like us mercenaries have to share every little detail.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Hmm... But lemme get this straight. I'm stronger than that old 'W,' huh?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Strong or weak doesn't tell me shit about a soldier's actual capabilities. For me, it's all about whether or not they can follow orders.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Fine, fine. I'll be more thorough next time. Does that work for you?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: By the way, I've been wondering, what kind of person was that old 'W?'
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: That guy... was a strange one.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: He was with us for a long time. Hardest worker you ever met, a real good egg.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: He fought hard to become our team leader, racked up kills and commendations, just so we'd celebrate his birthday.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...A Sarkaz? With a birthday?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Of course it wasn't his real birthday... He wasn't that far gone.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: He once killed a Laterano and took his gun. I guess they had some history between them, so he decided that day was his birthday.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Mhm... A merc who killed Lateranos for sport, huh? Sounds like we could've been friends.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: There's a lot to unpack in there.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But, 'for sport?'
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hey, gotta live in the moment.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Good answer.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: 'W' was one of our biggest characters.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: He always had that devil-may-care laugh, but whenever he spoke, you could tell that there was something more lurking underneath.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But he was quicker to trust than pretty much anyone else.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Why's that?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Because he had an 'obsession.' Obsessed people, good or bad, are always falling into traps.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...All right. Just sounds like a dumbass to me.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I figured you'd get it..
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Because you're the same type of person. Good at putting on airs, good at living in the moment.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I am?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: What makes you so confident you can guess what I'm thinking? Or, do you have some weird Arts like Ines?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You could've decided to kill us both that day. I thought you understood that?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: *Sigh*... You're not going to let that go, are you? Reminds me of Ines...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Let's head back and see how our Messenger's doing.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: It's about to rain.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: That's the first time I saw her smile. The same smile as W's.
Giving her a thinly-veiled excuse was at least better than having her continue this numbingly dull busywork.
What I needed was a mercenary who could cleave a path forward, not just another puppet. Puppets are a dime a dozen..
That was the day W became W.
...But Ines was right.
Ridiculous.
Ines, you should head back to the tent. No use staring blankly at a campfire.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hmph. Can't imagine we got good news from Kazdel.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Nail on the head.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I could feel the Messenger's anxiety after he came back. He tried not to show it, but he was scared out of his mind.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...Not to mention your expression. Your poker face couldn't fool a toddler.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: So, what's the bad news?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: So, I'm still alive, but... our agent died in Kazdel's industrial area.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: His corpse got thrown into a furnace. His head got melted off, but those gaudy red pants are somehow still fine.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Who did it?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Nobody knows when it happened. First person to find the body was one of the boiler workers.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But, whoever did it was quick. You have a fight on metal and it's gonna show for a while—
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: They used a knife. And they were damned good with it.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Whatever. It's not like we'll ever catch them.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: He wanted to hang out in Kazdel and didn't like to take orders. And this is what happens. Kinda funny, huh?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But now who's gonna pay us? I'm not laughing.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: And the next part is even less funny.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: When our Messenger was leaving Kazdel after confirming the report, he ran into some friends...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Some... spies.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I guess it's more 'was intercepted by' than 'ran into.'
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...So, we've been caught again?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Wouldn't be the first time. We could take the initiative here...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: By the look of things, we don't have a choice. The Messenger came back with an order.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...An order? For us? From who?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Since when do we take orders from anyone?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I've gone through the options. Just let me finish.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: They want us off the battlefield and up to a remote mountain pass. Looks like it might take us through a canyon.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...To protect a transport team.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Escorting transports is a pretty run-of-the-mill job. There has to be more to it, right?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...I don't know.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...Excuse me?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Really sorry. The situation's spiraled out of control—
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But this could be a rare opportunity for us.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Now that we're responsible for the entire team, the situation has changed. Everyone else is looking for an opening, and we can't just sit around waiting to die.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You and W are in charge of this job.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...I have some issues here.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: First of all, I won't go with W.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She's made some waves, but I don't think she's ready yet.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She's totally proven herself.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I see things you can't. I trust my Arts.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hoederer's team shows up with a new demolitions expert, and suddenly the battlefield is one big fiery explosion.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The other mercs are all playing it cool. The 'battlefield' changes every day, and you never know when it might swallow up your base camp.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...I know.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: She doesn't hesitate; not when she's lying, not when she's killing. She is too 'qualified' a mercenary. I can't tell how deep she is.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I'm not looking for a knife in my back, and I don't think she's cut out for this 'escort' job. No matter how great you think she is, now's not the time to send out your greenhorn.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Or did you have some ulterior motives?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I'm working with the tools I've got.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Look at where we are. We can't leave people on the sidelines anymore.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Mercs don't have a dog in the fight, really. But that also means we don't belong anywhere. When the dust settles, we'll fade away, along with the war.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The difference is, war will return one day. But we have only one chance to live.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I'm not going to be fatalistic about this... and neither should any of you. That's the deal.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We have to play the hand we've been given. Stand out from the crowd, and stake out our own position.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...That group's here from Rim Billiton. I'm willing to bet they get raided not long after crossing into Kazdel territory.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: A lot of our people won't take the job. We'll have to change the teams up a bit, but it doesn't matter in the end.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: It's a dangerous contract, but worth the risk. We, or at least you—
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hold up.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Not that I question your decision... It's just that...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...Ah, forget it. Anyway, you don't need to be so uptight. I'll follow your orders, as always.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: But first, you need to calm down, then take a look at your own feet.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Oh... Are you talking about my shadow?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I can't read your eyes. What am I looking for?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Your shadow. It's trembling.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...It's windy. And the campfire is flickering.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You know what I'm talking about. All you Sarkaz are like this.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Don't always try to plan too far ahead. There are too many things you can't control. We're just mercenaries, after all.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...I'll keep that in mind.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: So, if you want me to bring W with me, what about you?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: What are you planning?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: That's on a need to know basis. You're safer this way.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: If you can't trust the other teams, you should at least trust your own.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I'm not hiding anything from you, it's just...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Out with it then.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Spill it!
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Who was it our Messenger met?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...'Babel.'
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: A sleeper cell Babel left in Kazdel.
attributes.name: Hoederer
